Legislative History of Laws

For legislative history of D.C. Law 7-208, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 31-1610.

DC CODE § 31-1605

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: Nothing in this chapter shall be construed as preventing or restricting insurers or their agents or employees from following standard procedures for determining the insurability of or establishing the rates or premiums for new applicants diagnosed by a licensed physician as having AIDS, provided that the procedures:
Apply in the same manner to all other new applicants within the same category of insurance;
Are justified on the basis of actuarial evidence; and
Comply with other laws and rules of the District.

chapter.text: Prohibition of Discrimination in the Provision of Insurance on Basis of AIDS Test. (Refs & Annos)
